section.title: Overview
section.p: The NCC supports role-based access privileges (RBAC) assign privileges to NCC users for specified types of objects and actions within given security domains. All NCC objects belong to a security domain, which is the default security domain unless specified otherwise.
For example, using roles one user may be given read-only access to a rule system whereas another user may have read/write access (and still a third may have no access at all).
See the Global Configuration Guide for more information about User roles and access privileges.
